title: Salmonella
summary: Salmonella is a genus of rod-shaped (bacillus) Gram-negative bacteria of the family Enterobacteriaceae. The two species of Salmonella are Salmonella enterica and Salmonella bongori. S. enterica is the type species and is further divided into six subspecies[2][3] that include over 2,600 serotypes.[4] Salmonella was named after Daniel Elmer Salmon (1850â€“1914), an American veterinary surgeon.
